senses.de: An idea or plan that you offer for someone to think about
senses.ex: She made some very helpful suggestions for improving the proposal.

Tips.title: Expressing Ideas
Tips.description: Use 'suggestion' when presenting a new idea, especially in group settings or meetings.
Tips.example: I have a suggestion for increasing productivity.

Tips.title: Polite Proposals
Tips.description: 'Suggestion' is polite, not forceful, conveying willingness to consider alternatives.
Tips.example: Might I make a suggestion regarding the schedule?

Tips.title: Opening Discussions
Tips.description: A 'suggestion' can initiate discussion without committing to a specific course of action.
Tips.example: As a suggestion, perhaps we could survey our customers.

senses.de: A hint or indication about something
senses.ex: His face gave no suggestion of his actual thoughts.

Tips.title: Subtle Clues
Tips.description: Use 'suggestion' to point out subtle cues that imply something indirectly.
Tips.example: There was a suggestion of irritation in his voice.

Tips.title: Implied Meanings
Tips.description: 'Suggestion' can be about implied meanings rather than direct statements.
Tips.example: The dark clouds were a suggestion that rain was coming.

Tips.title: Reading Between Lines
Tips.description: Detect 'suggestion' when interpreting unspoken or hinted messages in communication.
Tips.example: His hesitation was a suggestion that he disagreed.

senses.de: The process of leading or causing a person to consider something, especially through indirect methods
senses.ex: Through a process of suggestion and reassurance, he eventually convinced them to agree.

Tips.title: Persuasion Technique
Tips.description: 'Suggestion' in psychology means gently influencing others to consider a point of view.
Tips.example: The therapist used suggestion to challenge the patient's fears.

Tips.title: Indirect Influence
Tips.description: Indirect 'suggestion' can be powerful in guiding someone without explicit instruction.
Tips.example: With clever suggestion, he guided them to the solution.

Tips.title: Subconscious Impact
Tips.description: 'Suggestion' might work subconsciously, affecting thoughts or actions without overt persuasion.
Tips.example: The ad relied on suggestion to create a desire for the product.

Advice.wordDefinition:
Advice and suggestion are two similar words that express different ideas and have different uses.

Advice is a recommendation or guidance given by someone who has expertise or experience in a particular area.

It is usually more authoritative and personal in nature. For example, if you are seeking career advice from a professional, they might give you advice on which jobs to apply for, and how to present your credentials.

Advice is typically given by someone who has knowledge or experience in an area, while suggestions can come from anyone and are less authoritative.

Advice is also more specific and personalized, while suggestions provide a general direction but leave room for the person to make their own choices.

Counsel.wordDefinition:
Counsel is advice given by a professional or an expert in a specific field. For example, a lawyer may give legal counsel to a client.

Both counsel and suggestion are applicable in different situations. Counsel is more formal and usually given by professionals, while suggestion is more casual and can be given by anyone.

Counsel is usually given to help solve a specific problem, while suggestion can be given for a variety of reasons.

Hint.wordDefinition:
A hint is a subtle or indirect clue or piece of information that suggests something, whereas a suggestion is a proposal or idea put forward for consideration or action.

Hints are often used when someone is trying to give a clue or help someone in figuring out something, but they don't want to say it directly.

For example, if someone loses their keys, a person might drop a hint by saying something like, "Maybe check the pockets of your jacket."

In summary, hints are more subtle and indirect, while suggestions are more straightforward and offer possible solutions or ideas.

Idea.wordDefinition:
Idea refers to a thought or concept that someone has come up with.

An idea is applicable when someone is trying to come up with something original or innovative, while a suggestion is applicable when someone wants to offer help or advice to someone else.

Opinion.wordDefinition:
An opinion is a personal belief or feeling you have about something, and it may or may not be based on facts. For example, "In my opinion, the movie was boring.".

Both can be applicable in different situations. Opinions are often used when expressing personal thoughts, experiences, or preferences.

Overall, when giving an opinion, you are sharing your own thoughts and feelings, and when giving a suggestion, you are sharing an idea or recommendation that may be beneficial to someone else.

Proposal.wordDefinition:
A proposal is a formal plan or offer that is presented for consideration or acceptance. This means that a proposal is a well-thought-out idea that is usually supported by facts, research, and other evidence.

For example, a company might submit a proposal to a potential client outlining their services and costs.

A proposal is a formal plan or offer based on research and evidence, while a suggestion is a more informal idea or thought.

Proposition.wordDefinition:
A proposition is a formal statement or proposal made for consideration and acceptance. It often refers to an idea or plan that is being put forward for others to agree with or act upon.

A proposition is a more formal idea or statement that is meant to be agreed upon, while a suggestion is a less formal recommendation meant to be considered.

Recommendation.wordDefinition:
A recommendation is a piece of advice that someone gives based on their experience or expertise.

It is usually given with the intention of helping someone make a decision or take an action. For example, a doctor may give a recommendation for a certain medication to treat a patient's illness.

A suggestion is an idea or proposal that someone offers, usually in a less formal way than a recommendation.

A recommendation is a specific piece of advice given with a clear intention, while a suggestion is an idea offered to inspire or stimulate thought.

quotes.Text: Businesses should encourage all their staff to come up with ideas, not be afraid to make suggestions, and then to act on those suggestions. There is nothing worse than going to a job every day were you feel like you are not making a difference to either the place you work or the world you live in.
quotes.Name: Holly Branson

quotes.Text: I surrender to my directors. I do that because I respect them immensely. In fact, a director's talent scares me. I admit that they're more intelligent than me, and I submit to that, as an assistant director does. Even when I have suggestions to make, I don't state them strongly.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Vijay Sethupathi

quotes.Text: What many of us object to is the politicians who, for whatever reason, forget that societies cannot easily absorb huge numbers of new citizens. I resent the suggestion that this perfectly reasonable view is motivated by racial hatred or personal spite.
quotes.Title: English Journalist
quotes.Name: Peter Hitchens

quotes.Text: I think it's important to create an atmosphere where actors feel like they can try things out. It doesn't mean that I'll take every suggestion, but I want there to be some room for actors to grow.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Steve Buscemi

quotes.Text: When you take on more than the norm, your boss can't help but think that you're capable of a bigger role. This includes showing that you're willing to take risks by making innovative suggestions.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Travis Bradberry

quotes.Text: The theater of the mind is impossible to compete with, and I like the idea that with a few suggestions, each reader forms in his or her own mind what a character or a place looks like.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Jerry B. Jenkins

quotes.Text: The employees who share innovative ideas may also be the folks who have some hidden talents that would help incorporate their suggestions.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Harvey Mackay

quotes.Text: I'm not from that world where you get on your feet and somebody gives you a suggestion and you improv your way through things.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Kevin Dunn

quotes.Text: None of us is immune to suggestion. We are social beings and live in a social world.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Siri Hustvedt

quotes.Text: I'm someone who doesn't often ask for help, just suggestions.
quotes.Title: American
quotes.Name: Aquaria
